pullRequest.title: use fw with more expected value placeholders
pullRequest.bodyText:
JIRA link (if applicable)
https://tools.hmcts.net/jira/browse/RDM-7283
Change description
Currently, we are supporting [[ANY]] literal to allow for any value of any type in a field in the actual response details (headers, body fields, etc). But this is a feature that mandates presence of a value in the field, no matter the type.
Replace [[ANY]] with relevant  literals to allow nulls and not nulls respectively.
Does this PR introduce a breaking change? (check one with "x")
[ ] Yes
[X] No

commit.message:
Merge branch 'develop' into RDM-7457

# Conflicts:
#	build.gradle
#	src/test/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/integrations/DefinitionsCachingIT.java
RDM-7504 - added explicit header for 404 responses even though BEFTA_RESPONSE_HEADER_CHECK_POLICY=JUST_WARN set.
RDM-7504 - added explicit header for 404 responses even though BEFTA_RESPONSE_HEADER_CHECK_POLICY=JUST_WARN set.

activate header checks with fw prerelease (#790)

* activate header checks with fw prerelease

* update expected value for Content-Type field.

* use fw prerelease

* adapt test data to new response structure

Co-authored-by: Sateesh Mathangi <sateeshkumar.m@gmail.com>
RDM-7504 - putting back accidentally deleted files
add response header expected after SB upgrade
add new header expeted after SB upgrade
use fw with more expected value placeholders
use fw with more expected value placeholders

Merge branch 'develop' into RDM-7283_Expected_Value_Placeholders

nodes.bodyText: ANY_INTEGER_NULLABLE can be used here.. This applies to all the Content-Length headers
